elements.2211.03238_5844aba2882062a3ea7855acf9a2b: The statistics of breaking wave fields is characterised within a novel multi-layer framework, which generalises the single-layer Saint-Venant system into a multi-layer and non-hydrostatic formulation of the Navier-Stokes equations
elements.2211.03238_77835528e094f9d7258e9342ff0c8: We simulate an ensemble of phase-resolved surface wave fields in physical space, where strong non-linearities including wave breaking are modelled, without surface overturning
elements.2211.03238_740606bd2ebc4d2eb7ab993415896: We extract the kinematics of wave breaking by identifying breaking fronts and their speed, for freely evolving wave fields initialised with typical wind wave spectra
elements.2211.03238_078a30cff1376ce8f61c9435419e6: distribution, defined as the length of breaking fronts (per unit area) moving with speed
elements.2211.03238_5eaceed9dab663cbf9316a5eae237: following Phillips 1985, is reported for a broad range of conditions
elements.2211.03238_ec13ead50386714f745f659d5f691: scaling without any explicit wind forcing for steep enough wave fields
elements.2211.03238_49895cea3c2dff9eedf4b7a3e3ccb: based solely on the mean square slope and peak wave phase speed is shown to describe the modelled breaking distributions well
elements.2211.03238_ef3a2d99351a808a31ef2fa792fb7: The modelled breaking distributions are found to be in good agreement with field measurements and the proposed scaling is consistent with previous empirical formulations
elements.2211.03238_02363158e343376ab0dc13f4b5352: The present work paves the way for simulations of the turbulent upper ocean directly coupled with realistic breaking waves dynamics, including Langmuir turbulence, and other sub-mesoscale processes.
elements.2211.03238_5e6e410b8874e14423f9ef152cba7: Wave breaking occurs at the ocean surface at moderate to high wind speed, with significant impacts on the transfer of momentum, energy, and mass between the ocean and the atmosphere
elements.2211.03238_77d51374b94783f19e59d540d265d: When waves break, the water surface overturns, which generates sea spray and largely enhances the gas exchange
elements.2211.03238_3fdb10267766678d0fff6876d098f: Visually it manifests as white-capping, widely observable at sea above a certain wind speed
elements.2211.03238_20258463e2f696d4cd9761333c2a3: Breaking acts as an energy sink for the waves: it limits the wave height by transferring the excessive wave energy into underwater turbulence and currents, therefore influencing the upper-ocean dynamics as well
elements.2211.03238_9f0de388f9160faa4659067100298: Describing breaking waves analytically and numerically has been challenging due to its nonlinear nature and the fact that the interface becomes multi-valued
elements.2211.03238_0c997c23ff7a6eb9d4a5e160d5483: Considering a single breaker, scaling analysis have been successfully proposed for energy dissipation, validated by laboratory experiments
elements.2211.03238_0d18027453ab2a73eed8ff9925c60: ; and thanks to advances in numerical methods and increasing computational power, high fidelity simulations on single 3D breakers have emerged
elements.2211.03238_52b606ac25f5705b5e38f8c340f2c: distribution to describe the statistics of breaking waves, where
elements.2211.03238_34d017c32e91cd8caf4bb019dfa68: is the expected length per unit sea surface area of breaking fronts propagating with speeds in the range of
elements.2211.03238_9dda9740115178be2b10930c991c5: The independent variable breaking front propagating speed
elements.2211.03238_141bbea24c74c9a4503b2f2033fd2: is chosen in place of wavenumber
elements.2211.03238_4f44dc8360fa8fa5576f8ab509eaf: because it is a more observable quantity
elements.2211.03238_33a684f6b682c40a6a0b0b4b3f5f2: The link to the wave spectrum is made through the core assumption that
elements.2211.03238_b3e5feedc9b7628b77aca04f63f54: is proportional to the wave phase speed
elements.2211.03238_67ed89f1e22b6f81c9ba520087842: distribution is predicted to have a
elements.2211.03238_9e54f62361a99666d0f23262c84f8: The moments of the distribution have a physical interpretation, with the second moment related to the whitecap coverage, the third to mass exchange, the fourth to momentum flux and the fifth to energy dissipation by breaking
elements.2211.03238_64bd3bae3729c7255e0543aaf41b4: Several observational studies have been conducted, which provide measurements of the
elements.2211.03238_ae9237f4ab938bfad235e985d2ed0: , made possible by technical advancement including ship-borne and air-borne visible and infrared imagery
elements.2211.03238_c25e786f148eeea628c13499e0b15: Scaling relations have been proposed to describe the breaking statistics for a wide range of conditions, but are facing the usual challenges in scatter of field data
elements.2211.03238_1ae21e11de8995def2874eec8f19e: , combined with ongoing discussions about the interpretation of
elements.2211.03238_b863d1e5bcaf15cf2864d94f24c8d: Beyond the single breaker description, numerical methods have so far been unable to describe the breaking statistics emerging from an ensemble of propagating surface waves
elements.2211.03238_1b784b97eb20f96d4b04315a4f8a9: We propose a numerical framework, leveraging a novel multi-layer formulation of the Navier-Stokes equations and its numerical implementation
elements.2211.03238_cd9cb6edbee548163982629bf5692: , which is able to capture the multi-scale nonlinear wave field, together with the intermittent incidences of breaking
elements.2211.03238_7a4e4e7af888ef90ed9e40ee129b5: The wave field is initialised using characteristic wind wave spectra based on field observations
elements.2211.03238_b86f0de1b3a1dfbaa3322aae94c51: We report the kinematics of the breaking statistics,
elements.2211.03238_22457df857b3d1de816e57cd66c4b: , and its scaling with the mean-square slope and discuss how to link our results to field measurements.

elements.2211.03238_9f22a69a4cc821e15950e63eb3591: is the horizontal momentum equation, where the pressure (divided by density) is split into a
elements.2211.03238_a52123687459271d09f13f3d29462: The last term is the momentum flux due to the non-hydrostatic pressure projected onto the horizontal gradient of the vertical position of each layer
elements.2211.03238_dacc9f2e4f2d477fea8a99f4c6a7b: Note that this set of equations does not make any assumption on the slope of the layers, which explains the
elements.2211.03238_812993255f9327524c2471f7f9c46: `metric' terms appearing in the horizontal momentum equation (
elements.2211.03238_199885dea224089a677abaa49226c: This is particularly important in the context of steep breaking waves
elements.2211.03238_c0c096423d39f24d97c5e48ca167d: One can further demonstrate that this set of semi-discrete equations is a consistent discretisation of the incompressible Euler equations with a free-surface and bottom boundary
elements.2211.03238_9a774bd14b9068098ddcac6f017a9: Note that, in the hydrostatic and small-slope limit, generalised vertical coordinates are widely used in ocean models
elements.2211.03238_814d14c9f6eff2912968f55fbf4fc: , due to the anisotropic nature of geophysical flows
elements.2211.03238_de91e9c321bf6f90f63f38f3072b0: The choice of the target remapped discretisation is flexible and reflects physical considerations
elements.2211.03238_080f28386197ba32ed9f2ddcb57b9: Here, the remapping step uses a geometric progression of the layer thicknesses which ensures higher vertical resolution of the boundary layer under the free-surface.
elements.2211.03238_4c712d89ba95003689e53181344be: The numerical schemes (spatial and temporal discretisations, field collocation, grid remapping, etc.) are described in detail in
elements.2211.03238_ee3c7a7e35fc9306e94d2cc90ed64: , and ensure accurate dispersion relations and momentum conservation.
elements.2211.03238_1915828d6ea7d1902edc56e7870a9: The dissipation due to breaking is modelled with a simple,
elements.2211.03238_e134d7a42c73f66f54af1585fdae2: approximation which can be related to the dissipation due to hydraulic jumps in the Saint-Venant system, known to be a surprisingly good first-order model for (shallow-water) breaking waves
elements.2211.03238_391145922ef382a4902d0877c76da: The horizontal slope for any layer
elements.2211.03238_b0e141e168fbe1ac1662154e95e8c: is limited by a maximum value
elements.2211.03238_00c4c2829bcdb12c895865b5df079: The slope limiter acts to stabilise the solver, and dissipates some amount of energy.
elements.2211.03238_7fd8bcb37fb4b7ad0d184686b6a04: We have tested that altering the value of
elements.2211.03238_57fa613dc42ac27ed1bae1867dac1: between 0.4 and 0.6 does not change the numerical results significantly
elements.2211.03238_b8bd5896fb0126673189c81c99d40: Note that given enough horizontal resolution and vertical layers, and added viscous diffusion terms, the multilayer model converges to the full Navier-Stokes equations, with underwater turbulence, and the dissipation rate obtained from breaking is close to that obtained with direct numerical simulations.

elements.2211.03238_e1d18c63848cdf9b925dd2a2350a3: Note that the observational data are obtained from complex sea states, and do not necessarily have the same spectrum shape as the current numerical data.
elements.2211.03238_bcf00211cac60f752a3f832e5ecc9: The wave field at a certain time and space is the result of the wind forcing history, and breaking is caused by excessive energy in the wave spectrum
elements.2211.03238_1af8ee8fbb819550113efee001888: For a mature and steep enough wave field, breaking (particularly those at large scale) is primarily dictated by the wave spectrum itself, while for younger and less steep wave fields, breaking can be more closely coupled to wind forcing
elements.2211.03238_001470d655ceef0aff4a1ca7c5988: It explains why the slope-based scaling or a mixed-wind-slope-based scaling can better fit data from various sea states.

elements.2211.03238_b10ff25f218e45d760420fd7118aa: In addition to the physical discussion of breaking statistics, we demonstrate the capability of the multi-layer approach to solve highly nonlinear geophysical flows with strong vertical-horizontal anisotropy.
